title: Understand the Method
text: In the addition method, we aim to eliminate one of the variables by adding the equations together. This helps us create an equation with only one variable so we can solve for it easily.

title: Prepare for Addition
text: Choose a variable to eliminate by making its coefficients in both equations equal in magnitude but opposite in sign. In this case, you can manipulate either 'x' or 'y'.

title: Focus on Eliminating 'y'
text: To eliminate 'y', adjust both equations so that the coefficients of 'y' are opposites. This requires a small multiplication to one of the equations.

title: Scale the Second Equation
text: Multiply the entire second equation by $$5$$. What does the new second equation look like?

title: Add the Equations
text: Now, add the two equations together: $$3x+5y=-11$$ and $$5x-10y=55$$. What is the resulting equation?

title: Solve for 'x'
text: Divide both sides of the equation $$8x=44$$ by $$8$$. What is the value of 'x'? Please enter only the number value.

title: Find 'y'
text: Substitute $$x=5.5$$ into the original second equation $$x-2y=11$$ to solve for 'y'. What is the value of 'y'? Please enter only the number value.

title: Verify the Solution
text: Check if the values of $$x$$ and $$y$$ satisfy both original equations. Is $$(5.5$$, $$-1.75)$$ a valid solution? Please enter Y or N (Y $$=$$ yes, N $$=$$ No)
